summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to the FBI, requesting confirmation of name spellings before issuing subpoenas. It indicates ongoing investigative activity in the Epstein case in August 2020.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, is requesting confirmation of name spellings from the FBI before issuing subpoenas.

events.title: Subpoena Preparation Request
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails the FBI to confirm the correct spellings of names before issuing subpoenas.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 27, 2020, from a federal prosecutor to the FBI.
The prosecutor is preparing to issue subpoenas and is verifying the spelling of names.
This indicates active investigative steps were being taken in the Epstein case over a year after Epstein's death.
